oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of an unknown Union officer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Carte-de-visite of unknown Union officer wearing a badge representing the 20th Corps. The 20th Corps were mainly from New York, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey. The reverse of the image is labeled with a stamp from the gallery the Metropolitan Gallery, J.H. Van Stavoren College St. 53, in Nashville, Tenn. Imagine likely taken no earlier than November 1863. Reverse of image also includes a revenue stamp, these revenue stamps were typically used from 1863-1866.
